main_text.sentence: Additionally, neither autoantibody titers at first diagnosis nor autoantibody behaviour in the time course of the disease are prognostic markers for AIH-1 [14,15,47].
Splenectomy is followed by reduction of autoantibody peripheral blood titre [12,13].
This hampers the autoreactcive T-cell generation and autoantibody production [25].
In 1988 a second autoantibody marker of AIH-2 was recognized [19].
The autoantibody is organ specific but not species specific and was therefore called anti-LC1 [19].
The LKM type 1 autoantibody (anti-LKM-1) is the characteristic serologic marker for the diagnosis of AIH-2 [5,18,63,72].
